qas.question: How many people were intended to be served by digital transmitters, according to CBC's application?
How many people were previously served by analogue transmitters before the upgrade?
In what area of Victora was CBC and Radio-Canada available?

plausible_answers.text: existing coverage areas were not necessarily maintained

qas.question: The CBC lost customers due to their practice of doing this?
The CBC provided false data regarding analog versus digital stating that the coverage would change from what numbers respectively?
The CRTC recommended continued analog transmission in what area?

plausible_answers.text: some northeastern parts of the metropolitan area

qas.question: CBC was replaced with Radio-Canada in what area of Victoria?

context: In markets where a digital transmitter was installed, <b3_0>existing coverage areas were not necessarily maintained<b3_0/>. For instance, the CBC implemented a digital transmitter covering Fredericton, New Brunswick in the place of the existing transmitter covering <b5_0>Saint John, New Brunswick<b5_0/> and Fredericton, and decided to maintain analogue service to Saint John. According to CBC's application for this transmitter to the CRTC, the population served by the digital transmitter would be <a0_0><b4_0>113,930 people<a0_0/> versus <a1_0>303,465<b4_0/><a1_0/> served by the existing analogue transmitter. In Victoria, the replacement of the Vancouver analogue transmitters with digital ones only allowed <a2_0>only <b6_0>some northeastern parts<a2_0/> of the metropolitan area<b6_0/> (total population 330,000) to receive either CBC or Radio-Canada.
